newsitem.title: HUNGARY: BLACKBURN SAYS BOUGHT FOTEX SHARES.
newsitem.headline: BLACKBURN SAYS BOUGHT FOTEX SHARES.

text.p: Panama-registered Blackburn International, the biggest single shareholder in Hungarian retailer Fotex Rt , announced on Thursday it had bought a total of 74,563 Fotex shares earlier this week.
Blackburn purchased 50,000 Fotex shares at 215 forints per share on Monday and bought 24,563 at 205 forints per share on Tuesday, it said in the official bourse gazette.

Fotex shares rallied sharply last week and earlier this week and market talk at that time said the rise might be connected to a recent conflict between two main Fotex shareholders, Fotex's General Manager Gabor Varszegi, via his Blackburn holding, and Templeton Emerging Markets.
Templeton said last month it was suing Fotex for violating minority shareholders' rights and failing to comply with Hungarian securities regulations.
But Gabor Varszegi, Fotex's founder, denied Templeton's allegations and accused the fund of attempting a hostile takeover.
